Slipping into stage ‘business’ with practised ease, HARDY does a lot of simpering and twiddling of his tie to the GIRLS; but when LAUREL does a goofy smile and waves to on them an ‘annoyed’ HARDY slaps him down. Laughter - it all seems to be going well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Late afternoon, the sun starting to set. LAUREL and HARDY to the side of the stage, at the bottom of some steps, ou view of the audience - and once again ignoring each other stage PHOTOGRAPHERS snap away as the three beauty contest FINALISTS parade for the crowd. Eventually:

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: I was talking to this fella about eggs... I know you’re interested in eggs. He said they get dried powder to supplement the ration. (HARDY ignores him) You get a packet a month, same as twelve eggs. Doesn’t taste too good, but you can make omelettes with it. (Still no answer) That’s what he said.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: I have nothing to say.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Well I have nothing to say to you either. And you can forget what I just said ‘cos I won't be repeating it.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Good. LAUREL gets a nod from the ORGANIZER, cutting the conversation short. A moment, then he bounds up a few ste onto the temporary stage. HARDY goes to follow him but pa on the steps. LAUREL takes the microphone to enthusiastic APPLAUSE.  Stan and Ollie - Goldenrod Revisions 20.04.17 77 LAUREL (cont'd) Hello everybody. Mr. Hardy and I would like to thank you for making us feel so welcome today here in Worthing, one of my favourite seaside towns... Applause. He sees HARDY, still on the steps. LAUREL (cont'd) Don’t forget we're appearing next week at the Lyceum... ** He looks to HARDY, waiting for him to join him - but he doesn’t move. LAUREL (cont'd) Tickets still available. Weak laughter. LAUREL (cont'd) Well all that remains is to crown today’s lovely winner- The ORGANIZER hands him an envelope, then the winner’s ti LAUREL gives him back the envelope so he can take the tia realises he doesn’t have the envelope so gives him the ti so he can take back the envelope. All good business and h getting laughs, but still HARDY doesn’t join him. LAUREL (cont'd) (Harsh whisper) Will you quit sulkin’? But HARDY just doesn’t move. LAUREL opens the envelope. LAUREL (cont'd) And the winner is... The BAND strikes up a fanfare; LAUREL looks to HARDY, sur that he will now grab the envelope from him and read out winner’s name himself. But HARDY stares ahead, glazed eye then sways and with a last, anguished look to LAUREL, los consciousness - for real. He slumps down the steps and sl to the ground below. At first the crowd assumes it’s part the act and laughs - but when LAUREL jumps down off the s to tend his friend the mood becomes fearful and the music stops. A couple of REDCOATS push the crowd back. LAUREL (cont'd) Give him some air - please! LAUREL helps HARDY into the recovery position. LAUREL (cont'd) What is it Babe - what is it?  78 79 Stan and Ollie - Locked White Shooting Script 22.02.17 78

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: I felt faint Stan... like somebody turned the lights out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A taxi pulls up outside the hotel and the TAXI DRIVER hur round to help LAUREL get HARDY - who looks absolutely terrible - from the back of the cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAUREL and the TAXI DRIVER get HARDY inside.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: (To TAXI DRIVER) Thank you so much, I can take it from here with the Bell Boys. Watched with great amusement by a couple of BELL BOYS, LA goes to hand the TAXI DRIVER a half crown. LAUREL (cont'd) Thank you so much this is for you. But he hands the TAXI DRIVER the money round the back of HARDY, whilst the TAXI DRIVER goes to receive it round th front. It’s entirely accidental and quickly corrected, bu the BELL BOYS assume it’s a bit of impromptu entertainmen

dialogues.speaker: TAXI DRIVER
dialogues.text: (Now taking the coin) Thank you sir. The TAXI DRIVER leaves and LAUREL turns to the BELL BOYS.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Could you help me get Mr. Hardy up to his room please, he’s not feeling too good. But the BELL BOYS think it’s a set up, and just smile at HARDY almost falls and LAUREL has to grab him quickly to him upright. The BELL BOYS just laugh - assuming this is ‘business’. LAUREL is getting desperate: LAUREL (cont'd) I need some help here! The BELL BOYS look at each other - neither wanting to be butt of what they assume will be a prank. One of them wig his tie at them, ‘Hardy-style’, waiting to be entertained LAUREL (cont'd) No, I really...  80 81 Stan and Ollie - Locked White Shooting Script 22.02.17 79 But, exasperated, he sees they are not going to help him. so - alone - LAUREL is forced to stagger across the foyer the elevators, using all his strength to keep HARDY uprig As the elevator doors open and LAUREL eases HARDY inside, BELL BOYS still think something’s going to happen. LAUREL pokes his head out before the doors shut: LAUREL (cont'd) I really did need some help you know. And the BELL BOYS fall about laughing. He pulls his head in and the doors shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The seriousness of Hardy’s condition, and the poignancy o LAUREL having to help his friend all by himself, is broug home as we see LAUREL struggling desperately to get a sem conscious HARDY back to his hotel room, inching painfully along the corridor a step at a time until, finally, he manages to knock on his door. LUCILLE - in her dressing g opens it, sees the state HARDY is in and blanches.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: He took a funny turn. INT. HARDY’S SAVOY HOTEL ROOM - NIGHT 81

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAUREL and LUCILLE get HARDY to the bed and lay him down.

dialogues.speaker: LUCILLE
dialogues.text: Oh my goodness...

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: We were about to go on stage and he said he wasn’t feeling too well, and he sort of collapsed.

dialogues.speaker: LUCILLE
dialogues.text: Collapsed! LUCILLE makes a grab for the phone. LUCILLE (cont'd) I need to get a doctor right now.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: (Weakly) No doctor...

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: I got him back here as fast as I could.  82 83 84 Stan and Ollie - Locked White Shooting Script 22.02.17 80

dialogues.speaker: LUCILLE
dialogues.text: You should have taken him to a hospital - look at the state he’s in-

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: I tried-

dialogues.speaker: LUCILLE
dialogues.text: (She gets through) -yes hello this is Mrs Hardy in room 430 I need a doctor to attend to my husband right away please. (Listens) Mr. Oliver Hardy, yes. As LUCILLE waits on the phone:

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: I’m really sorry Lucille.

dialogues.speaker: LUCILLE
dialogues.text: Thank you Stan, I’ll take it from here... LAUREL looks miserably at his stricken friend on the bed, LUCILLE on the phone. A moment then he turns and leaves, shutting the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAUREL walks along in a daze, all the worries of the worl his shoulders. INT. LAUREL’S SAVOY HOTEL ROOM - NIGHT 83

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAUREL sits on the edge of his bed, loosening his collar tie, dumbstruck. IDA kneels at his feet, silently unlacin his shoes and taking them off for him. She looks up at hi knows there’s nothing she can say. INT. HARDY’S SAVOY HOTEL ROOM - NIGHT 84

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DOCTOR finishes listening to HARDY’S heart with his stethoscope. He listens intently, then removes the instru from his ears and folds it up.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: I can get you admitted to hospital tonight-

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: LUCILLE
dialogues.text: Oliver don’t be ridiculous.  85 86 Stan and Ollie - Blue Revisions 24.03.17 81

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: (Weak, distressed) I’m not going to hospital. I’m in the middle of a very important tour and we also have a movie scheduled to go into production. I just had a funny turn.

dialogues.speaker: LUCILLE
dialogues.text: Oliver please!

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Mr. Hardy I believe you've suffered a mild heart attack today. I also believe that there is some evidence of congestive failure.

dialogues.speaker: LUCILLE
dialogues.text: Oh dear God, I knew it-

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: If you won't admit yourself to hospital here, I suggest you go home as soon as you possibly can to seek specialist treatment in the United States. You cannot possibly go on stage again in your current condition. HARDY stares at him, dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAUREL has met with DELFONT for breakfast. He toys with h food, no appetite; DELFONT again tucks in enthusiasticall

dialogues.speaker: DELFONT
dialogues.text: What’s the latest?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Lucille won't let anybody near him.

dialogues.speaker: DELFONT
dialogues.text: So we can’t expect him back any time soon?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: I don’t think so.

dialogues.speaker: DELFONT
dialogues.text: Shame, the advance London bookings are very strong. Everybody wants to see you. The show’s a huge success.  87 Stan and Ollie - Blue Revisions 24.03.17 82

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: It’s not Babe’s fault he got sick.

dialogues.speaker: DELFONT
dialogues.text: Of course not, of course not. He cuts off a strategic slice of smoked salmon, wolfs it down. A few moment’s silence, then DELFONT ‘casually’ cha tack. DELFONT (cont'd) Stanley am I right in thinking that before you teamed up with Oliver you worked with other partners?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Well, I had lots of different partners in Vaudeville yes, I once worked with Charlie Chaplin, but...

dialogues.speaker: DELFONT
dialogues.text: And of course Oliver made his elephant film with a different partner?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: What’s that got to do with anything?

dialogues.speaker: DELFONT
dialogues.text: Oh.. I don’t know, random thought - there’s a very popular double act here called Cook and Baker, I know them very well. Cook is the Hardy to Baker’s Laurel, if you see what I mean. (Takes a sip of orange juice) I was just wondering whether you might not consider trying a couple of shows with Nobby Cook, just to keep things going until Babe can return?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: You mean, go on without Babe?

dialogues.speaker: DELFONT
dialogues.text: No no. Silly idea. DELFONT glances at LAUREL and can see he’s got him thinki that he’s planted a seed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAUREL walks nervously up to Hardy’s hotel room. He knock moment, then LUCILLE answers. She looks at him coldly:  Stan and Ollie - Blue Revisions 24.03.17 82a

dialogues.speaker: LUCILLE
dialogues.text: Please don’t tire him out.  88 Stan and Ollie - Locked White Shooting Script 22.02.17 83 LUCILLE grabs her bag and exits. LAUREL goes inside. INT. HARDY’S SAVOY HOTEL ROOM - DAY 88 HARDY is propped up in bed with pillows, looking pale. He sees LAUREL enter and gives him a weak smile. LAUREL take his coat off, sits on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: I got you a present. He pulls two boiled eggs from his pocket and holds them o

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: Eggs? It looks like Laurel is echoing the moment on stage when visits Hardy in hospital - but he’s perfectly serious.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: I went down to the kitchen to see if they could spare any. Cost me three shillings each. HARDY takes them, delighted.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: I‘’1l have one now if I may. He starts to peel the shell off one straight away; sees LAUREL looking enviously at the other one. HARDY (cont'd) Go ahead. LAUREL needs no further encouragement, and takes the othe egg, also starting to peel it.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: I’1ll get you some more. The two men peel the shell off their eggs contentedly. LAUREL (cont'd) Where’s Lucille gone? She could have stayed, it was just a silly row about nothing the other day. Just... nothing. (Beat) I got something to tell you Ollie-

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: (Overlapping) I’m retiring.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: -about the movie... what? Stan and Ollie - Locked White Shooting Script 22.02.17 8 LAUREL falls silent, cut off in mid-sentence.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: The doctor’s told me I can’t go on with the tour, and I’ve promised Lucille I won't. LAUREL stares at him - no words will come out. HARDY (cont'd) So I’m retiring Stan. I’ve promised Lucille and that’s all there is to it. I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: I should never have made us take this tour.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: Je ne regret rien. And you shouldn't regret rien either.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Can’t you rest, and then we can start again when you're better?

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: (Shakes his head) He’s told me my heart won’t stand it. I’m going back home as soon as we can arrange a crossing. A long beat. HARDY can see LAUREL’S finding this so difficult. Both of them hold their half-finished eggs.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: You're retiring...

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: Yes. Retiring. HARDY looks at his friend, his head down, clearly devasta HARDY (cont'd) I know how much this tour, and... doing the picture meant to you.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Oh that’s... forgotten. (Long beat) You're retiring. It's like he has to say it out loud again, as if this wil somehow change things. HARDY can see he’s in distress.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: (Beat) What have you been working on? Stan and Ollie - Locked White Shooting Script 22.02.17 8

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: What? LAUREL takes out a handkerchief from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: What new scenes for the movie have you been working on?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: (Loudly blows his nose) Oh... nothing really. HARDY gives LAUREL a hard stare. Silence. Finally LAUREL meets his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: Now aren’t you ashamed of yourself?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: Lying to me, your oldest and dearest friend, here on my sickbed.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: I don’t know what you mean?

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: I haven’t seen you for two days, and you're trying to tell me you haven't been working on any new material in that time? A beat, then LAUREL has to smile. HARDY (cont'd) Come on then, out with it.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: (Long beat) I did think of this romantic scene. You're pining for Maid Marian, who has been holed up in the castle by the Sheriff of Nottingham-— LAUREL even feels sufficiently cheered to take another bi of his egg. Through a mouthful he continues: LAUREL (cont'd) -so we hear this sad violin music. HARDY starts to hum some sad, sweet tune to LAUREL. LAUREL (cont'd) And it’s all too much for you, and you begin to cry. Stan and Ollie - Locked White Shooting Script 22.02.17 8 HARDY starts to look upset as he hums, wiping away a ‘tea LAUREL (cont'd) And the tears begin to fall. And they fall pretty heavy, splashing down your cheeks... but I’m not upset one bit and I don’t know what to do, but you’re crying so much... so what I do is move a pot plant under you to catch them, so the plant gets a good watering, and it starts to grow like crazy... HARDY slaps his thigh and laughs, LAUREL is thrilled.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: The props guys can fix me up so the tears are like two little waterfalls - it'll be a riot! That’s great Stan, that’1ll go big. As he laughs HARDY is gripped by another coughing fit; LA quickly hands him a glass of water but HARDY has to find breath first before he takes a sip; he slumps back agains his pillow, exhausted. HARDY (cont'd) Can you get me another blanket, I feel so cold. LAUREL grabs another blanket and throws it over him.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Your hands are like ice. He gets under the blanket with him to warm him up, lying right next to him - just like they did in their films. LAUREL (cont'd) There, is that better? The two men lie together happily side by side, each envisaging the ‘pot plant’ scene - but knowing they’1l ne get to perform it. A beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: Have you spoken to Delfont?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Yeh I saw him this morning. They are both gazing up at the ceiling rather than at eac other as they talk.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: What'd he say?  Stan and Ollie - Pink Revisions 17.03.17 87

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Well he didn’t know you were retiring of course but he asked me, since you were sick, how I felt about carrying on the show with somebody else.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: English comedian, called Nobby Cook.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: That makes sense.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: I haven't said I would yet. HARDY turns to LAUREL.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: Why not? You didn’t get sick. (Beat) It’s for the best Stan.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Yes. Maybe it is. HARDY returns to gazing at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: Well, that’s it. I’m retiring, and you're going on with a new partner.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Yes. That’s it. OUT on the two of them in bed together, accepting the end

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The auditorium is empty, a rehearsal in progress. Nobby C 50s, not Hardy’s size but a big, stout, northerner, is on stage lying on the bed in the hospital set we are now so familiar with. DELFONT brings LAUREL onto stage and introduces him to COOK.

dialogues.speaker: DELFONT
dialogues.text: Stanley can I introduce you to Nobby Cook, one of our finest music hall comedians. COOK looks nervous, but LAUREL shakes his hand warmly.  Stan and Ollie - Yellow Revisions 31.03.17 88

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Very pleased to meet you Nobby - I heard a lot of great things about you.

dialogues.speaker: COOK
dialogues.text: How do you do Mr. Laurel, I’m a big fan of yours - watched all your films.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Come on now, we’ll have none of that - I’m Stan and you’re Nobby. I’m looking forward to working with you.

dialogues.speaker: COOK
dialogues.text: Thank you very much, very nice of you to say so. How’s Mr. Hardy?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Oh he’s doing fine, and sends you his very best wishes.

dialogues.speaker: COOK
dialogues.text: That means a lot to me.

dialogues.speaker: DELFONT
dialogues.text: This is terrific. You two are going to be just terrific together... DELFONT allows himself a satisfied smile. LAUREL is tryin very hard to be positive. DELFONT (cont'd) Shall we have a run through?

dialogues.speaker: COOK
dialogues.text: If you like - it’s up to Stan.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: (Beat) Why don’t I go out and then come back in and we can run it from the top.

dialogues.speaker: DELFONT
dialogues.text: Good idea. LAUREL walks back to the wings. He picks up a bunch of flowers and a paper bag that has been put there for him. sees COOK readying himself in the hospital bed, his leg i the plaster cast which is then hoisted up on pulleys.

dialogues.speaker: COOK
dialogues.text: Beltin’ this. Guaranteed laugh here Stan.  Stan and Ollie - Yellow Revisions 31.03.17 88A COOK gives LAUREL a smile and a thumbs up, which LAUREL returns, trying to reassure him. COOK then briefly runs s lines in his head, saying them quietly to himself:

dialogues.speaker: COOK
dialogues.text: What have you got there? Hard boiled eggs and nuts. Hard boiled eggs and nuts? Don’t be so daft! What’s the matter with you - you know I can’t eat them... As we see LAUREL listening to him, we see he’s as uncomfortable about this as Hardy was all those years ago  Stan and Ollie - Pink Revisions 17.03.17 89 DELFONT (OOV) (cont'd) Okay and... cue Stanley! 90 INT. HARDY’S SAVOY HOTEL ROOM - NIGHT 90

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUCILLE feeds HARDY, laid up in bed, some soup from a bow like he’s a sick child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That same poster tells us that ‘Hollywood’s Greatest Come Couple’ are appearing; but a pasted-on banner strip reads ‘Tonight featuring Nobby Cook - the Lancashire Hot-Pot’..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAUREL is alone in his dingy dressing room, applying his usual pancake-white make up. Something causes him to paus for a moment, deep in his thoughts. Under this we hear:

dialogues.speaker: GUARD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Open up - we know they’re in there!

dialogues.speaker: MAID MARIAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Quick, hide... 93 INT. CASTLE - DAY [ROBIN HOOD ‘MOVIE’] 93

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door is smashed open and half a dozen GUARDS burst in.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: MAID MARIAN
dialogues.text: I don’t know what you’re talking about. One of the others attracts the GUARD’S attention, nodding a curtain with two sets of feet poking out from the botto The GUARDS gesture amongst themselves to ‘sshhh’ and cree over to the curtain. Two of them draw swords, and...

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: A-ha! A-ha! So you think you can Play that game do you- -they both stab viciously through the curtain at chest height. A moment’s confusion, then they pull the curtain to reveal LAUREL (Stanley-A-Dale) and HARDY (Friar Hardy) their knees looking up at them, shoes tucked under them l Toulouse-Lautrec. [Note: the boys are physically in their prime, just like they looked in ‘Way Out West’]. 94 INT. HARDY’S SAVOY HOTEL ROOM - NIGHT 94

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARDY, now alone in bed, smiles, as if thinking to himsel the same piece of material. Under this we hear:  95 Stan and Ollie - Blue Revisions 24.03.17 90

dialogues.speaker: HARDY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We’re on our way to give him a piece of my mind, aren’t we Stanley?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We sure are.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We’d give him a piece of his too, but he doesn’t have any to spare. EXT. SHERWOOD FOREST - DAY [ROBIN HOOD ‘MOVIE’ ] 95

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there are LAUREL and HARDY, standing on one end of a across a river running through the forest, attempting to cross. ROBIN HOOD blocks their way. HARDY is dressed as ‘Friar Hardy’ in a cassock, his hair in a monk’s tonsure; LAUREL is standing next to him, as ‘Stanley-A-Dale’ with feather in his hat. Again it’s the ‘Robin Hood’ movie tha didn’t happen, brought to life in Laurel’s imagination.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN HOOD
dialogues.text: And what, pray tell, has Robin Hood done to inspire such wrath?

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: Well, we’ve heard that he steals from the poor to give to the rich, isn’t that right Stanley?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Isn’t that stupid? That’s just robbing Peter to pay Paul - he’s got the whole thing the wrong way round.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: Exactly. Our idea, you see, is to give to the poor by stealing from the poor. And thereby cutting out the middle man.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: The rich need never be any the wiser.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: Precisely. So, if you’d please stand aside we have important business afoot... HARDY steps forward but ROBIN HOOD bars the way with his staff, jabbing him in the belly with it. They look at eac other, sizing things up.  Stan and Ollie - Green Revisions 11.04.17 90A HARDY (cont'd) So that’s the way you want to play it?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Didn’t you hear what he said about his foot?

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: I’m warning you, I’ve got great stick work. + eH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 96 97 98 Stan and Ollie - Green Revisions 11.04.17 91 HARDY takes a sudden swipe at ROBIN HOOD, who deftly avoi it; he tries another, same result. LAUREL positions himse behind HARDY and taps him on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Watch he doesn’t hit you on the leg. Then ROBIN HOOD brings his staff crashing down on HARDY’S head, snapping it in half. HARDY howls in pain, drops his staff, gingerly touching his skull. LAUREL, standing behi HARDY, starts to laugh. HARDY gets really annoyed with hi because of this and punches him in the throat - making hi tongue come out. LAUREL retaliates by punching HARDY on t nose; HARDY howls with pain, they get into a shoving matc and HARDY ends up in the river. He sits in the water, spits some out of his mouth, wipes eyes. There’s some heavy flapping from inside his cassock he wriggles around until he pulls out a huge salmon and throws it away. He LOOKS TO CAMERA, full of utter frustra with what he has to put up with, then he looks up at LAUR on the log, staring at him blankly.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: Well, here’s another nice mess you’ve gotten me into. LAUREL spreads his hands, guilty face, beginnings of a ‘c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAUREL looks at his reflection in the mirror, his face ol and tired. There are tears in his eyes. INT. HARDY’S SAVOY HOTEL ROOM - NIGHT 97

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On HARDY in bed, tears rolling silently down his cheeks. LUCILLE, her back to him as she writes a letter, chatters away oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: LUCILLE
dialogues.text: Isn’t this so much nicer, all the worry gone, just you and I relaxing together. I spoke to mother today and she passes on her love, she’s knitting you a scarf...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A decent-sized audience is in for tonight’s performance. DELFONT takes a seat next to IDA, ready for the show. The lights dim, the orchestra strikes up a breezy introductor number. DELFONT looks excited, eagerly anticipating this partnership. IDA looks more nervous.  99 Stan and Ollie - Green Revisions 11.04.17 91aA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAUREL, in costume, waits in the wings to go on, he looks through a crack in a curtain to check the size of the audience. We can see how anxious and troubled he is by wh he is about to do. He turns, sees COOK getting into the hospital bed and having his foot encased in the comedy plaster cast.  Stan and Ollie - Yellow Revisions 31.03.17 91A As he turns to LAUREL, COOK strokes a little Hardy-style moustache he’s been given by the make-up department:  100 101 102 Stan and Ollie - Yellow Revisions 31.03.17 92

dialogues.speaker: COOK
dialogues.text: What do you think Stan - I thought I’d try and look the part? LAUREL returns a nervous smile.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: That’s fine. That’s fine. LAUREL makes a cursory check of his heels and cuffs, tryi to convince himself he’s perfectly fine with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DELFONT and IDA wait patiently for curtain up. And they wait... but it doesn’t lift. Some restlessness in the audience. What’s going on? Finally, after a few more mome the orchestra stops and the THEATRE MANAGER walks out on stage into a spotlight.

dialogues.speaker: THEATRE MANAGER
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, I’m afraid due to circumstances beyond our control tonight’s performance has been cancelled... A large murmur of discontent. DELFONT looks around at the full house, in despair.

dialogues.speaker: DELFONT
dialogues.text: Cancelled! IDA realizes straight away what has happened.

dialogues.speaker: IDA
dialogues.text: Oh Stanley...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IDA enters the bar. She sees LAUREL, by himself, a tumble Scotch in front of him, smoking a cigarette. She goes ove him, sits down next to him.  Stan and Ollie - Green Revisions 11.04.17 93 She gently takes his cigarette and stubs it out; and as before takes his Scotch and drinks it, to stop him drinki it.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: (Beat) When you watch our movies, nobody else in the stories knows us. And we don’t know anybody either. It was just the two of us, the only thing we had was each other. And that was the way we wanted it. (Beat, looks at her) I love him Ida. IDA looks at him and gently smiles. She nods, accepts his decision.

dialogues.speaker: IDA
dialogues.text: We go home? LAUREL nods.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Don’t tell Babe. Tell him I’m going to continue with the dates in Ireland... it’d upset him to think of me cancelling the tour. (Beat) I’m sorry my darling... 103 INT. HARDY’S SAVOY HOTEL ROOM - DAY 103 LUCILLE brushes her hair in front of a mirror as she chat away to HARDY, who stares ahead, thoughtfully.

dialogues.speaker: LUCILLE
dialogues.text: «+. the doctor thinks you should be well enough to travel tomorrow, which is wonderful. Now I’m going to go down and see if there’s any mail, and then the Laurels will be stopping by to say goodbye - I do hope it’s not going to rain today when that wind gets up the chill cuts right through to the bone...  104 105 106 Stan and Ollie - Pink Revisions 17.03.17 94 She stands up, final check of her appearance in the mirro LUCILLE (cont'd) I won't be long papa. She kisses him on the forehead and leaves. HARDY, lost in thoughts, doesn’t say a word. INT. LAUREL’S SAVOY HOTEL ROOM - DAY 104 LAUREL sits in a chair, three packed suitcases nearby, re to go downstairs. He concentrates gloomily on the door as flits about picking up the last few bits from the room. S when the Bell Boy comes through that door, it’1l all be o

dialogues.speaker: IDA
dialogues.text: You have money for Bell Boy? LAUREL nods. He looks at the door. There’s a knock. IDA (cont'd) Answer please I need bathroom. You give him five shillings only. No more. As IDA disappears into the bathroom LAUREL hauls himself with a sigh, fumbles through his pockets for change and o the door... to find a fully dressed HARDY standing outsid He’s pale and a little unsteady on his feet, but his eyes clear and his expression determined. LAUREL looks at him, speechless. INT. HARDY’S SAVOY HOTEL ROOM - DAY 105

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUCILLE lets herself in.

dialogues.speaker: LUCILLE
dialogues.text: One of the Bell Boys down there, Raymond I think his name was, said to tell you he had a good tip for you on a horse... She walks through to the bedroom. LUCILLE (cont'd) Have you been gambling Oliver Hardy? She sees the empty bed, Hardy’s crumpled pyjamas on it. A instantly, she knows what has happened. INT. LAUREL’S SAVOY HOTEL ROOM - DAY 106

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAUREL and HARDY face each other over the doorstep. Final HARDY speaks:  Stan and Ollie - Pink Revisions 17.03.17 94a

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: Come Stanley, I believe we have some engagements to fulfil.  107 108 Stan and Ollie - Locked White Shooting Script 22.02.17 95 On LAUREL, a long beat. Then, he understands what this me He and HARDY don’t need to say any more, they just look a each other. INT. HARDY’S SAVOY HOTEL ROOM - DAY 107 LUCILLE sits on the bed, upset but not angry. Deep down s knew this was inevitable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun shines in a clear, bright sky but it’s bracing up deck. HARDY is lying on a deck lounger wrapped in a blank LUCILLE next to him. IDA and LAUREL (wearing his beret) w back to them from a trip around deck.

dialogues.speaker: LUCILLE
dialogues.text: I think we should all get below now, out of this wind.

dialogues.speaker: IDA
dialogues.text: Dahling I agree.

dialogues.speaker: LUCILLE
dialogues.text: Oliver? Will you at least listen to me about this? Or are you determined to catch pneumonia?

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: I’m enjoying the fresh air honey. Stan come and sit with me - you girls go ahead. LUCILLE hesitates for a moment, not happy.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: I‘1l bring him down. She nods, gives LAUREL a smile. Then she and IDA depart. LAUREL takes a beret from his pocket and hands it to HARD LAUREL (cont'd) Here. Thought you might want this back. HARDY looks at him, smiles, takes back the beret he threw Laurel during their big argument and pulls it on his head

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: Thanks. LAUREL sits down next to him, takes a pair of gloves from pocket and pulls them on, finger by finger, carefully mak sure each one is pulled on tight. HARDY watches with increasing exasperation. Then, finally:

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Babe... I lied to you.  Stan and Ollie - Pink Revisions 17.03.17 96

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: (Stern expression) What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: There is no movie. (Beat) Miffin told me a couple of weeks ago it had fallen through. I guess... nobody wants a Laurel & Hardy picture any more. (A few moments as this sinks in) But if I’d told you straight away... well maybe we could have finished the tour early and you wouldn't have got sick.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: (Beat) You knew two weeks ago that there was no movie?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Yes. And I been feelin’ terrible about it. On HARDY, a long beat. Then...

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: Stan, I knew.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: I knew.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you tell me you knew?

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: I thought you already knew I knew.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: How could I know that you knew I already knew.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: (Flounders for a moment) What’s the next line?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: ‘I thought you already knew I knew, but you were pretending you didn’t know I knew’.  Stan and Ollie - Blue Revisions 24.03.17 96A

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: So if you knew, why did you let me keep rehearsing the movie with you?

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: What else are we gonna do?  109 110 111 Stan and Ollie - Pink Revisions 17.03.17 97 They exchange a smile. HARDY pulls his coat up around his neck against the cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caption Cobh harbour, Ireland The steamer heads into Cobh harbour, an old seaport on th southern coast of Ireland dominated by St. Coleman’s Cathedral, towering over the quay from its hillside perch We see feet, small feet - some with no socks, just in clo running. We see CHILDREN emerging from street corners to their way down to the quayside - where a crowd is gatheri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LAURELS and HARDYS make their way up out of the ship’ interior on to the gangplank, LAUREL with two big cases a HARDY just a small valise (their old trick whenever they arrive somewhere). But they stop as they look out at the quayside. We now...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: -what they see: a huge crowd of people of all ages has gathered to greet them, standing patiently, silently. IDA LUCILLE drop back so that LAUREL and HARDY can walk down gangplank together. Once the crowd sees them, the big guy the little guy from the movies, a great cheer erupts. As descend the gangplank hats are thrown in the air and the crowd surges forward to greet them. Then, just as they re the bottom of the gangplank, something extraordinary happ From the cathedral bells at the top of the hill, ‘The Dan Of The Cuckoos’ - the boys’ theme tune - is rung out from bell tower. LAUREL and HARDY look at each other, unable t quite believe what is happening. They both weep openly, amazed at the reception, at the warmth and love which eng them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight’s performance by ‘Hollywood’s Greatest Comedy Cou has ‘SOLD OUT’ banners pasted over the posters.  112 113 114 Stan and Ollie - Yellow Revisions 31.03.17 98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A full house, all ages; the audience impatient to see the heroes. We see LUCILLE and IDA in the front row, DELFONT to them, beaming with pride. His hands are clasped firmly together, a small sign of how nervous he is. Of how much, deep down, he really does care about the boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARDY is having his leg hoisted up in ‘traction’, LAUREL checks his cuffs and heels. Their eyes meet, and they exchange that nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house lights go down, an expectant hush. ‘The Dance O The Cuckoos’ begins, curtain goes up and there is the hospital room set, HARDY in bed, leg in plaster. Applause LAUREL enters stage left with the bunch of flowers and pa bag and at the sight of the two men together there is ren applause, whistles and even cheers. LAUREL waits for it t die down.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Hi Ollie, how are you?

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: Never mind how I am - what took you so long to get here?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Well they said no visitors so I said I was your son and it worked like a charm.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: My son! You have a lot of nerve telling them I was your father.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: I couldn’t tell them you were my mother.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: Of course you couldn’t. I’ve never even been married... Big laughs - the audience are loving it.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: What have you got there?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: I brought you some hard boiled eggs and some nuts. HARDY looks to the audience, exasperated, and they laugh.  Stan and Ollie - Yellow Revisions 31.03.17 98a

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: Now you know I can't eat hard boiled eggs and nuts! If you wanted to bring me something why didn't you bring me a box of candy?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Well, they cost too much.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: What has that got to do with it?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: And you didn't pay me for the last box I brought you. Laughter. LAUREL offers HARDY the bag:

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Have one?

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: No. I’d rather not. (To the audience, with disgust) Hard boiled eggs and nuts... LAUREL ignores him, takes an egg out and starts to peel i and eat it. HARDY watches, incredulous, as Laurel pulls a salt cellar from his pocket and sprinkles some on. We see DELFONT smiling at what he sees on stage but, as e twisting his head round to make a quick mental calculatio the size of the house. Business is business...  115 116 117 Stan and Ollie - Yellow Revisions 31.03.17 99 We see LUCILLE, next to IDA. LUCILLE is worried, but tryi to smile through it. IDA seems calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The double door routine. HARDY sweaty, but still on his f his and LAUREL’S timing slick as ever as one goes in one door, the other emerges through another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAUREL and HARDY, helped by their DRESSERS, hurriedly cha into their battered suits and Bowlers for the finale. Out there is clapping, cheering and whistling. As they wait i the wings, ready to go on, LAUREL is concerned with how exhausted HARDY looks - drenched in sweat, breathless fro the effort he’s put in already, struggling to even get on jacket.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: You look tired out Babe - why don’t we just go out and say goodnight and finish it there? We don’t have to do the song...

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: I’m fine... (Sudden thought) Listen, I had this idea for the picture. How about I grab Robin Hood's staff and go to hit you with that, but instead I knock down this bees’ nest and it lands on my head?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: (Smiles) That’s a swell idea. That’1l go big. The ‘Dance Of The Cuckoos’ strikes up out front, and the curtain starts to open.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: It was fun while it lasted, wasn’t it Stan.  Stan and Ollie - Pink Revisions 17.03.17 99R LAUREL smiles, then waits for his cue. On that same note walks out - only to be hooked back by HARDY- HARDY (cont'd) I‘1l miss us when we're gone.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: So will you. Now HARDY walks out on stage, and LAUREL kicks him up the as he goes.  Stan and Ollie - Yellow Revisions 31.03.17 100

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARDY and then LAUREL walk on together to a storm of clap and cheering; they wait patiently for it to die down.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen we hope you've enjoyed our bit of fun tonight, we've sure enjoyed ourselves haven't we Stanley?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: We certainly have.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: We'll never forget the warm welcome we've received here in Dublin.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Not just Dublin, but the whole of Scotland.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: Dublin isn’t in Scotland.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: (thinking) I was wondering why we got on that boat. (realising, whispering to

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: We must be in Ireland.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) We must be in Ireland! Another burst of applause.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: We'd like to finish tonight with a little dance... HARDY and LAUREL share a look.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: From our film ‘Way Out West’. Maestro... Stanley. Then, just as LUCILLE looks like she’s about to pass out worry, she feels IDA’S hand reaching for hers. She’s shoc She turns to her, and IDA smiles. LUCILLE smiles back, an squeezes IDA’S hand warmly, grateful that she’s there to support her at this moment. They both turn back to the st still holding hands.  Stan and Ollie - Yellow Revisions 31.03.17 100aaA On stage HARDY, in that very proper way of his, extends a hand which is taken by LAUREL - and now they are also hol hands. They bow to the audience then wait for the music c  Stan and Ollie - Blue Revisions 24.03.17 100aAa As the orchestra starts ‘At The Ball, That’s All’, the BO tap their feet, then begin their dance routine once again and we are transported back to the magic of ‘Way Out West In spite of HARDY’S physical problems and illness, his li footedness is as exquisite as ever. And although both men now looking old, their grace and elegance defies their ye LAUREL matches HARDY every step of the way, the two danci together like the loving couple they most surely are. We finish behind LAUREL and HARDY, silhouetted against th lights, looking out at the audience. As they come togethe and hold each other’s hands, we FREEZE...  Stan and Ollie - Pink Revisions 17.03.17 100A Captions Laurel and Hardy returned to America after the tour, but never performed together again. Hardy’s health went into decline and, after a long illness, he died in August 1957 Stan and Ollie - Locked White Shooting Script 22.02.17 1 Laurel refused all offers to perform without his old part and went into retirement.
